31 Ps 114 5 7 Jn 2120 25 Sun June 8 Pentecost Sunday Acts 21 11 Ps 1041ab 24ac 29bc 30 31 34 1 Cor 123b 7 12 13 or Rom 88 17 Jn 2019 23 or Jn 1415 16 23b 26 The Ascension of the Lord June 1 2025 This weekend May 31st June 1st the Church celebrates the Solemnity of the Ascension of the Lord Traditionally observed on the fortieth day of Eastertide the Ascension actually fell this past Thursday However in our diocese as in most of the United States the celebration is transferred to the nearest Sunday This pastoral adjustment is meant to allow more of the faithful to come together in prayer as we reflect on this mystery of salvation history As described in our Collect for this morning's Mass the Ascension reminds us that where the head has gone before in glory the Body is called to follow in hope Or as St Paul would say our citizenship is in heaven Ephesians 320 Yet the Ascension of the Lord is followed by the descent of the Holy Spirit on Pentecost as we celebrate next Sunday This means that though heaven is our true homeland right now our mission field is right here on earth Pentecost Collection for the Education of Seminarians Next weekend you are invited to support the education and formation of our diocesan seminarians through the annual Pentecost Collection for the Education of Seminarians On behalf of our diocesan seminarians Thank You for your generous financial support and your continued prayers for these our future priests Your yes in supporting our seminarians empowers their yes to responding to Gods vocational call in their lives St Francis Summer Reading Program Next weekend June 7th 8th our annual St Francis Summer Reading Program begins This program running from June through July is meant to encourage our young parishioners to continue their religious formation throughout the summer by reading various faith filled books Books will be available in the Narthex starting next weekend and books can be checked out throughout the summer Those participating in the reading program will be able to claim prizes from the Prize Box throughout the summer At the end of summer the top readers in our various grade levels will be awarded special prizes including Chamber Bucks for their hard work If you are willing to help hand out prizes from the Prize Box after Masses each weekend please see the sign up sheet in the Narthex after Masses this weekend Parish Council Nominations We are now accepting nominations for the two open seats on the Parish Council Please see this weekend's bulletin insert for more details about the Council and the responsibilities of its members I invite you to prayerfully consider whether you are called to serve or feel moved to nominate a fellow parishioner whose gifts would benefit our parish family Nominations are open through June 30th Two names will then be chosen at random to fill the open seats cf Acts 126 Those selected will join our current Parish Council members Lori Bender Tyler Hoffacker Tom Jackson and Kevin Seago when our meetings resume on Wednesday August 13th Mark Your Calendars Corpus Christi Procession On Sunday June 22nd the Church celebrates the Solemnity of Corpus Christi Following the 10 AM Mass we will hold our annual Corpus Christi Procession through the parish campus and into our local community All are invited to join this sacred walk of witness a reminder that we are a pilgrim people journeying through this life in faithful pursuit of Jesus In a Eucharistic Procession we follow the Lord physically while also renewing our commitment to follow Him spiritually By our participation we give public witness to our faith and testify to our belief in His saving words I am the living bread that came down from heaven whoever eats this bread will live forever John 651 Come walk with us in faith and joy on Sunday June 22nd after the 10 AM Mass as we honor and testify to the Real Presence of Jesus Christ in the Eucharist Faithfully in Christ Fr David Mother Teresa of Calcutta Nominations for the Parish Pastoral Council What is a Parish Pastoral Council According to the Code of Canon Law a pastoral council is to be established in each parish the pastor presides over it and through it the Christian faithful along with those who share in the pastoral care of the parish in virtue of their office give their help in fostering pastoral activity What is the goal of the Parish Pastoral Council The primary goal of the pastoral council is to help every member of our parish family to grow together in holiness and achieve the fullness of the Christian vocation What is the purpose of a Parish Pastoral Council The purpose of the pastoral council is to counsel and advise the pastor in the area of pastoral activities to help the pastor identify any pastoral needs arising in the parish and to assist him in planning pastoral programs and in improving already offered pastoral services When does the Parish Pastoral Council meet The Parish Pastoral Council of St Joseph's meets on the first Wednesday of each month August through May following the 7:00PM Wednesday evening Mass for approximately 1 hour Who may I nominate for Parish Pastoral Council Any registered and active parishioner of St Joseph's Church who are at least 18 years of age You may nominate yourself or any other active parishioner who meets the above criteria I nominate the following individuals to serve on St Joseph's Parish Pastoral Council Please return form either in the Collection Basket or to the Parish Office by June 30 2025 Thank you Knights of Columbus Father Aloysius Phillips Council 7555 Saint Joseph was a just man a tireless worker the upright guardian of those entrusted to his care May he always guard protect and enlighten families St
